description: This is the bizarre moment a Honda SUV that was trying to avoid a tricycle ended up on the roof of a house in China. The incident occurred today in Taixing City.
title: SUV gets stuck on 10ft high roof confusing villagers
title_page: SUV gets stuck on 10ft high roof confusing villagers | Daily Mail Online
text:
This is the bizarre moment a Honda SUV that was trying to avoid a tricycle ended up on the roof of a 10-foot-tall house in China.
The male driver was stuck in the car for around half an hour until traffic police officers came to his rescue.
The incident occurred today in Taixing City and there were no reported injuries or casualties according to XianDai Daily.
The male driver claimed he pressed on the gas pedal by mistake and crashed into the roof
One onlooker told reporters that the black SUV was driving on Chenghuang highway and gained speed near a junction road.
The car leaned to the right and crashed into the roof of a row of houses, said to be 9.8 feet (three metres) tall, at the road side.
Video footage shows the car crashed onto the tile roof with two wheels on the left hanging in midair.
The houses are located 1.64 feet (0.5 metres) higher than road level and 9.8 feet (three metres) away from the traffic road at the side.
The male driver claimed he was driving at a speed of 37-43 mph (60-70 kph) when a tricycle came out from a small road.
In a bid to avoid crashing into the tricycle, he pressed on the gas pedal by mistake and drove at a high speed.
He then made a sharp right bend to avoid the tricycle and pedestrians, drifting away from the road and stuck on the roof.
The car 'flew' three metres (9.8 feet) and landed on the roof of two old houses in eastern China
The house is three meters high (9.8 ft) but only half a meter (1.64 ft) higher than the road level
The construction and style of the houses suggested that it was built at least 50 years ago.
XianDai Daily reporters reached out to the house owner and was told that no one is living in the house as it is for storage use only.
Onlookers heard a loud bang and came to find out what had happened.
Local traffic police officers arrived and took a ladder from the villagers to free the driver.
A crane company arrived shortly after to remove the car from the roof.
There are no casualties reported and police are continuing to investigate the cause of the incident.
